{"id":1265323636,"question_id":2696,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"2Â weeks","timestamp":1716426035,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"14711 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1265323636/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"The Number of Beautiful Subsets","memory":"16.6 MB","code":"from functools import reduce\nclass Solution:\n    def beautifulSubsets(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> int:\n\n        subsets = 0\n        if len(nums) == 1:\n            return 1\n        \n        def is_beautiful(subset):\n            complements = []\n            for num in subset:\n                if num not in complements:\n                    complements.append((num + k))\n                    complements.append((num - k))\n                else:\n                    return False\n\n            return True\n\n        def generate_subsets(nums, cur_subset, index):\n\n            if index == len(nums):\n                if len(cur_subset) > 0 and is_beautiful(cur_subset[:]):\n                    nonlocal subsets\n                    subsets += 1\n                return\n\n            cur_subset.append(nums[index])\n            generate_subsets(nums, cur_subset, index+1)\n            cur_subset.pop()\n            generate_subsets(nums, cur_subset, index+1)\n\n        nums.sort()\n        generate_subsets(nums, [], 0)\n        return subsets","compare_result":"","title_slug":"the-number-of-beautiful-subsets","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
